Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as d28f08cf0238435ac92184fabaafd9c76bff62cf
what does the severity mean or indicate to the user?
it indicates how severe the error case is.
Done
remove commented section
Done
Tested Section ?
Checked few pels that were generated during the error cases
Done

Follow a consistent naming convention for enum values. Use CamelCase or PascalCase for enum names and enum values. Avoid using all-uppercase names to differentiate them from macros.

Also, assign values explicitly to the enums.

Done, Thank you for pointing, changed the Enum values to be all small cases as specified here - https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/enum. 
Also, I believe there is no need to explicitly specify the values of the enum if it's not needed in the use case. By default, it takes values from 0.
PascalCase*
this can be moved to the local scope of try block?
Done
why was this removed? shouldn't we add a specific error as added in the above case?

IMO it was discussed, pel was not necessary to be generated for this case, as it would flood with pels when we fail to get the correct response, rather than just have an lg2 error logged to debug what failed. We could add a pel if needed.
why include this change as part of this commit?
Done, was added as part of the clang-format issue.
same as above
Done
failure to ack is not considered as "ERROR"?
No, it was discussed that this pel would be just an informational pel rather than an error.
please make all value as CAPITAL letter, which is similar to other enum also.
The C++ core guidelines tells not to use all caps for enums as it will confuse with the macros. http://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#enum5-dont-use-all_caps-for-enumerators
Since we don't have any macro in the file, so it good to have all CAPITAL letter because we used mostly cap's in libpldm and other places also.
It's better to follow ISO standard guidelines. libpldm is a C library.

Can we make this as default parameter which takes pldm::PelSeverity::Error?
That way this parameter will be added only when the Severity is other than pldm::PelSeverity::Error
Acknowledged
please use map.contains(), the find() method is old and is not easily readable.
Done

Sorry , i was wrong earlier in my comments about moving this to map.contains().

It seems that map.contains() is better only in certain choosen cases where there is no need of accessing the found element. since in this case the element found is being used, its better to go back to find.

please find the relavant info at : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76087701/c20-contains-and-get-value-vs-find
Acknowledged. `find` looks to be better in this usecase.
Nit comments
Can reason be added in commit msg?
Why this is changed?
Done
This was changed to maintain uniformity in the pel message_registry.json. All the entries have a `.Error` segment to the pel error written.
